instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3332: What is 820-3332? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PUBS_G3H: What is PUBS_G3H? This is a typo of PPBUS_G3H When you see PUBS_G3H, assume they meant to type PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I'm working on this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that came in today. don't no the history. it has green/red light, <SIGNAL>PUBS_G3H</SIGNAL> is at 12.6v, next rail i checked was <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>, Found that it had 0.223v, checked and confirmed that it had a short to ground. chased it back to <CHIP>U1800</CHIP>.

i dont have a machine to recall a chip of this size. is it even worth messing with or just a no fix?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Resistance to ground on ppvrtc?
I would check <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and the 4 capacitors on the ppvrtc rail.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: i get 33ohms resistance to ground on pad 1 of <CHIP>U2600</CHIP>. i pulled <CHIP>U2600</CHIP> and the 4 capacitors and still 0.001 in diode mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: looks like a donor board to me. thanks guys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
[QUOTE="jgraffis, post: 23207"]looks like a donor board to me. thanks guys.[/QUOTE]

No, This is a Â£400 board. Send it to someone who can replace the PCH. Try get a trade rate.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: Certainly not a donor, replace the PCH and fix the BIOS!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: yea tried that before, this PCH is not that hard to replace...then flash the bios with clean ME then you have a 400 board for sale...which is in good demand in the market now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3332</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> short to ground on <SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>
threads.message: I'm guessing i would need a reball machine to replace the PCH and there is no one I'm my area that i know of that does that kinda of work. ill look around online and see if i can find some one. thanks.
